item.question: The user guru1 complains that he cannot access his homedirectory. Which of the following commands would fix this problem?
Which command can be used to examine kernel boot messages after boot time stored in memory?
item.hint: Although the boot messages are stored in a logfile the question is about reading the messages from the kernel ringbuffer. So answers like "less /var/log/messages" are incorrect. The answer can be just the commandname (i.e. less) or its complete pathname (i.e. /bin/less)
